etymologies: late 17th century (denoting the religious mysticism based on the teachings of the Spanish priest Miguel de Molinos (c1640–97)): from Italian quietismo, based on Latin quies, quiet- ‘quiet’

definitions: (in the Christian faith) devotional contemplation and abandonment of the will as a form of religious mysticism.
shortDefinitions: (in Christian faith) devotional contemplation and abandonment of will as form of religious mysticism

definitions: calm acceptance of things as they are without attempts to resist or change them
shortDefinitions: calm acceptance of things as they are without attempts
